metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Canvas is perfect for Scatter Plots
HTML Canvas is perfect for Line Graphs
HTML Canvas is perfect for combining Scatter and Lines
content.html: HTML Canvas is perfect for combining Scatter and Lines

content.code_html:
const xArray = [50,60,70,80,90,100,110,120,130,140,150];
const yArray = [7,8,8,9,9,9,10,11,14,14,15];

// Plot Scatter
 ctx.fillStyle = "red";
for (let i = 0; i < xArray.length-1; i++) {
  let x = xArray[i]*400/150;
  let y = yArray[i]*400/15;
  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.ellipse(x, y, 2, 3, 0, 0, Math.PI * 2);
  ctx.fill();
}

const xMax = canvas.height = canvas.width;
const slope = 1.2;
const intercept = 70;

// Plot Line
 ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(0, intercept);
ctx.lineTo(xMax, xMax * slope + intercept);
ctx.stroke();

let xMax = canvas.height;
let yMax = canvas.width;
let slope = 1.2;
let intercept = 70;

const xArray = [50,60,70,80,90,100,110,120,130,140,150];
const yArray = [7,8,8,9,9,9,10,11,14,14,15];

// Plot Scatter
 ctx.fillStyle = "red";
for (let i = 0; i < xArray.length-1; i++) {
  let x = xArray[i] * xMax/150;
  let y = yArray[i] * yMax/15;
  ctx.beginPath();
  ctx.ellipse(x, y, 2, 3, 0, 0, Math.PI * 2);
  ctx.fill();
}

// Plot Line
 ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(0, intercept);
ctx.lineTo(xMax, xMax * slope + intercept);
ctx.stroke();

content.text: Having a Plotter Object is nice when studying Artificial Intelligence:
content.html: Having a Plotter Object is nice when studying Artificial Intelligence:

content.code_html:
function XYPlotter(id) {

this.canvas = document.getElementById(id);
this.ctx = this.canvas.getContext("2d");
this.xMin = 0;
this.yMin = 0;
this.xMax = this.canvas.width;
this.yMax = this.canvas.height;
.
.

content.text: Add a Method for Plotting a Line

content.code_html:
this.plotLine = function(x0, y0, x, y, color) {
  this.ctx.moveTo(x0, y0);
  this.ctx.lineTo(x, y);
  this.ctx.strokeStyle = color;
  this.ctx.stroke();
}

content.text: Add a Method for Transforming XY Values

content.code_html:
this.transformXY = function() {
  this.ctx.transform(1, 0, 0, -1, 0, this.canvas.height)
}

content.text: Add a Method for Plotting Points

content.code_html:
this.plotPoints = function(n, xArr, yArr, color, radius = 3) {
  for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    this.ctx.fillStyle = color;
    this.ctx.beginPath();
    this.ctx.ellipse(xArr[i], yArr[i], radius, radius, 0, 0, Math.PI * 2);
    this.ctx.fill();
  }
}

// Create a Plotter
 let myPlotter = new XYPlotter("myCanvas");

// Create random XY Points
 numPoints = 500;
const xPoints = Array(numPoints).fill(0).map(function(){return Math.random() * myPlotter.xMax});
const yPoints = Array(numPoints).fill(0).map(function(){return Math.random() * myPlotter.yMax});

// Plot the Points
 myPlotter.plotPoints(numPoints, xPoints, yPoints, "blue");

content.text: Put the Code in a Library

content.code_html:
function XYPlotter(id) {

this.canvas = document.getElementById(id);
this.ctx = this.canvas.getContext("2d");
this.xMin = 0;
this.yMin = 0;
this.xMax = this.canvas.width;
this.yMax = this.canvas.height;

// Plot Line Function
 this.plotLine = function(x0, y0, x, y, color) {
  this.ctx.moveTo(x0, y0);
  this.ctx.lineTo(x, y);
  this.ctx.strokeStyle = color;
  this.ctx.stroke();
}

// Transform XY Function
 this.transformXY = function() {
  this.ctx.transform(1, 0, 0, -1, 0, this.canvas.height)
}

// Pot Points Function
 this.plotPoints = function(n, xArr, yArr, color, radius = 3) {
  for (let i = 0; i < n; i++) {
    this.ctx.fillStyle = color;
    this.ctx.beginPath();
    this.ctx.ellipse(xArr[i], yArr[i], radius, radius, 0, 0, Math.PI * 2);
    this.ctx.fill();
  }
}

} // End Plotter Object

content.text: Use it in Your HTML Pages
Now you can add your plotter object to your HTML pages:
content.html: Now you can add your plotter object to your HTML pages:

content.code_html: <script src="myplotlib.js"></script>
